marketNews.title: IMF Revises Down Global Growth Outlook for 2025
marketNews.content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Tuesday (10/22) revised down the global economic growth outlook for 2025 to +3.2%, which is lower by -0.1 percentage point compared to the previous outlook in July 2024. The global economic growth outlook for 2024 remains unchanged at +3.2%. Meanwhile, the IMF projects that global economic growth over the next 5 years will only reach +3.1%, a mediocre level compared to pre-pandemic times.

marketNews.title: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and IMF Economist on China's Stimulus
marketNews.content: US Treasury Secretary, Janet Yellen, said that her side has not seen the latest stimulus issued by China targeting a significant increase in domestic demand, which is key for China to drive its economic growth. In line with Yellen, IMF Chief Economist, Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas, mentioned that China's fiscal stimulus has been lacking in detail so far, so the IMF did not include this stimulus in its latest outlook. On Tuesday (10/22), the IMF revised down China's economic growth outlook for 2024 to +4.8%, lower by -0.2 percentage point compared to the previous outlook in July 2024.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Asks Ministers to Review Budgets, Reduce Ceremonial Events and Overseas Travel
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto has asked his ministers to review their budgets and cut ceremonial events and overseas travel to reduce costs. President Prabowo stated that there should be no problem with his larger cabinet compared to the Joko Widodo era if his cabinet can achieve total expenditure efficiency. President Prabowo also promised to reduce bureaucracy and bottlenecks, which investors fear will worsen given the current larger number of ministries.

marketNews.title: Minister of Industry Urges Making Draft Government Regulation on Natural Gas for Domestic Needs into Law
marketNews.content: Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, stated that he has corresponded with President Prabowo Subianto to turn the draft government regulation concerning natural gas for domestic needs into a government regulation. This draft regulation will become the legal basis for certain natural gas price incentives (HGBT), which are currently set to expire at the end of 2024.

marketNews.title: Minister of Agriculture Targets 1 Million Hectares of Rice Fields in First Year
marketNews.content: Minister of Agriculture, Andi Amran Sulaiman, stated that his ministry targets creating 1 million hectares of rice fields in the first year of President Prabowo Subianto's administration. Andi mentioned that this program is already running in Merauke, Central Kalimantan, South Kalimantan, South Sumatra, Aceh, and Jambi. The priority commodities for food self-sufficiency are rice and corn. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto reportedly planned to create 3 million hectares of agricultural land within a 5-year period.

tickerNews.title: UNVR: 3Q24 Performance Worsens, Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) recorded a significant net profit decline to 543 billion rupiah (-62% YoY, -47% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to only 3 trillion rupiah (-28% YoY), below expectations as it was equivalent to only 65% of the consensus FY24 estimate. The low net profit in 3Q24 was caused by declining revenue and weak margins. Revenue Fell Pressed by Volume Weakness - UNVR's revenue in 3Q24 only reached 8.4 trillion rupiah (-18% YoY, -7% QoQ), mainly pressured by a significant volume decline with domestic sales volume dropping -16% YoY. This resulted in revenue for 9M24 falling -10% YoY to 27.4 trillion rupiah. In the earnings call, UNVR management attributed the revenue decline to 3 factors: 1) inventory reduction across major channels; 2) disruption of distributor sales due to pricing instability and disharmony among various channels; and 3) the ongoing impact of boycotts. Operating Profit Margin Plummets - Pressure on net profit also came from the cost side, with the operating profit margin sharply declining to 8.7% in 3Q24 (vs. 3Q23: 17.9%, 2Q24: 14.6%). This decline was pressured by 3 factors: 1) decrease in economies of scale (diseconomies of scale) following the significant volume drop; 2) transformation and/or restructuring initiatives causing short-term production cost swelling; and 3) operating expense (opex) reduction not commensurate with the revenue decline due to relatively high advertising, research, and promotion costs. In its guidance, UNVR management expects that various ongoing initiatives by the company - such as inventory adjustment, pricing harmonization, and transformation - will only start showing results in 2H25. Key Takeaway With these weak results, we expect consensus estimates for UNVR's performance to be revised down again. In the last 3 months, the FY24 net profit estimate has been lowered by -9%. Meanwhile, UNVR's weak sales performance could be a positive indication for its competitors' sales, such as Tempo Scan Pacific (TSPC). UNVR management itself stated that the company's market share trend decreased in 3Q24 to 34.9% by value (vs. 10M23: 38.5%, 2Q24: 35.5%) and 28.4% by volume (vs. 10M23: 31.7%, 2Q24: 29%). Previously, we released Unboxing TSPC which you can read here.

tickerNews.title: BBCA 9M24: Net Profit +12.8% YoY, Exceeds Expectations
tickerNews.content: BBCA: Bank Central Asia recorded a net profit of 14.2 trillion rupiah (+1.4% QoQ, +16.1% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 41.1 trillion rupiah (+12.8% YoY), exceeding consensus expectations as it was equivalent to ~76% of the FY24F estimate of 54 trillion rupiah. This realization was supported by loan distribution growth of +14.5% YoY to 877 trillion rupiah. In 9M24, Net Interest Income rose +9.5% YoY to 61 trillion rupiah and Pre-Provision Operating Profit increased +14.6% YoY to 53 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ARNA 3Q24 Net Profit +3% YoY, on Track with Turnaround Thesis
tickerNews.content: ARNA: Arwana Citramulia recorded a net profit of 113 billion rupiah (+15% QoQ, +3% YoY) in 3Q24. This result made the net profit for 9M24 reach 316 billion rupiah (-10% YoY, vs. 1H24: -17% YoY), equivalent to 75% of Stockbit's FY24F estimate. The result in 3Q24 shows that the company is on track with our turnaround thesis in Unboxing ARNA, which we expect to continue in 4Q24. Revenue in 3Q24 reached 700 billion rupiah (+19% QoQ, +14% YoY), supported by volume growth which we estimate rose +12% YoY. Meanwhile, the gross profit margin in 3Q24 reached 34.6% (+160 bps QoQ, -150 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: MLBI 9M24 Net Profit +10% YoY, Driven by Strong 3Q24 Growth
tickerNews.content: MLBI: Multi Bintang Indonesia recorded a net profit of 318 billion rupiah (+33% QoQ, +35% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in 763 billion rupiah (+10% YoY) for 9M24. The growth in net profit in 3Q24 was supported by higher revenue growth (+29% QoQ, +22% YoY) compared to the cost of revenue growth (+15% QoQ, +8% YoY), thus improving all of the company's profit margins.

tickerNews.title: BREN Plans Capacity Increase to 1 GW by 2025 and 1.95 GW by 2030
tickerNews.content: BREN: Barito Renewables Energy plans to increase its total capacity to 1 GW by 2025 through existing capacity development and 1.95 GW by 2030 through greenfield project development, according to public expose material released on Tuesday (10/22). BREN currently has a capacity of 965 MW, consisting of geothermal power plants (PLTP) of 886 MW and wind power plants (PLTB) of 79 MW. BREN has budgeted 346 million US dollars or ~5.3 trillion rupiah for the next 3 years to add 104.6 MW of capacity.

tickerNews.title: HMSP 3Q24 Volume Sales Down -8.9% YoY, Market Share at 27.4%
tickerNews.content: HMSP: Philip Morris International recorded that Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna's sales volume reached 20.7 billion sticks (+5.6% QoQ, -8.9% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought HMSP's sales volume for 9M24 to 60.5 billion sticks (-4.6% YoY). On the other hand, industry-wide sales volume in Indonesia reached 75.5 billion sticks in 3Q24 (+5% QoQ, -3.3% YoY), so for 9M24 it reached 221.4 billion sticks (+0.9% YoY). Consequently, HMSP's market share was 27.4% in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: 27.3%, 3Q23: 29%) and 27.3% for 9M24 (vs. 9M23: 28.9%). Based on product segmentation, HMSP cigarette sales in 9M24 decreased by -5.3% YoY to 59.7 billion sticks, while IQOS grew 2 times to 0.8 billion sticks.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Announces Change in EGM Schedule
tickerNews.content: ADRO: Adaro Energy Indonesia announced a change in the schedule for the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) from Friday, November 15, 2024, to Monday, November 18, 2024.

tickerNews.title: BNBR Plans Private Placement to Convert Rp 855 Billion Debt, Dilution of 7.7%
tickerNews.content: BNBR: Bakrie & Brothers plans to conduct a private placement of 13.3 billion new shares at an execution price of 64 rupiah per share to convert debt amounting to 855 billion rupiah. This corporate action is aimed at improving the company's financial structure and will dilute existing share ownership by 7.7%. Eurofa Capital Investment Inc. and Silvery Moon Investment Ltd. will take part in the new BNBR shares, with post-transaction ownership positions of 6.76% and 0.94% respectively. Previously, both entities did not own shares in BNBR. This plan will be discussed in the EGM on November 28, 2024.

tickerNews.title: PNBN Clarifies Rumor on Maybank Malaysia Acquisition Interest
tickerNews.content: Bank Pan Indonesia (PNBN) stated in a clarification to the IDX that the news from Kontan regarding the rumor of Maybank Malaysia's interest in acquiring PNBN at a valuation of 1.7x PBV did not originate from the company's management, so the company does not know the source and truth of this information. Previously, Reuters reported in early October 2024 that PNBN's controller, the Gunawan family, and PNBN shareholder, ANZ Group Holdings Ltd., were considering selling their stakes. In September 2024, Bloomberg reported that potential buyers for ANZ Group Holdings Ltd.'s PNBN shares included banks from Japan and Malaysia.

tickerNews.title: PMMP Controller Sells 45.3 Million Shares for Operational Funding
tickerNews.content: The controller of Panca Mitra Multiperdana (PMMP), PT Tiga Makin Jaya, sold 45.3 million PMMP shares at an average price of 163.1 rupiah per share on October 15-21, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~7.4 billion rupiah and was intended for operational financing. After this transaction, PT Tiga Makin Jaya's ownership in PMMP decreased from 36.8% to 35.1%.
